trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting Service Bus
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting Service Bus

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe issues that may occur in writing applications for <token>sb1</token>, and how to resolve them.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe issues that may occur in writing applications for <token>sb1</token>, and how to resolve them.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting Service Bus applications
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting Service Bus applications

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe how to troubleshoot <token>sb2</token> applications.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe how to troubleshoot <token>sb2</token> applications.

trans-unit.source: Application runs in the development fabric, but crashes when it is deployed
trans-unit.target: Application runs in the development fabric, but crashes when it is deployed

trans-unit.source: Symptom
trans-unit.target: Symptom

trans-unit.source: A <token>sb2</token> application runs without error in the deployment fabric, but crashes after it is deployed to the <token>azure_1</token> servers.
trans-unit.target: A <token>sb2</token> application runs without error in the deployment fabric, but crashes after it is deployed to the <token>azure_1</token> servers.

trans-unit.source: Cause
trans-unit.target: Cause

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> assemblies are currently not integrated into the <token>azure_1</token> platform.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> assemblies are currently not integrated into the <token>azure_1</token> platform.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, the application is trying to access an assembly that does not exist on the server.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, the application is trying to access an assembly that does not exist on the server.

trans-unit.source: Resolution
trans-unit.target: Resolution

trans-unit.source: Add the <token>sb2</token> assembly to your deployment package (for example, set the assembly to <ui>Local Copy</ui>).
trans-unit.target: Add the <token>sb2</token> assembly to your deployment package (for example, set the assembly to <ui>Local Copy</ui>).

trans-unit.source: Note that therefore, you will have to update the assemblies manually.
trans-unit.target: Note that therefore, you will have to update the assemblies manually.

trans-unit.source: Endpoints can be set programmatically, but fail when set in the configuration file
trans-unit.target: Endpoints can be set programmatically, but fail when set in the configuration file

trans-unit.source: Symptom
trans-unit.target: Symptom

trans-unit.source: An application works when the endpoints are set programmatically, but fail when those same configuration settings are stored in the associated App.config file.
trans-unit.target: An application works when the endpoints are set programmatically, but fail when those same configuration settings are stored in the associated App.config file.

trans-unit.source: The application generates the following error:
trans-unit.target: The application generates the following error:

trans-unit.source: System.Configuration.ConfigurationErrorsException: Configuration binding extension 'system.serviceModel/bindings/netTcpRelayBinding' could not be found.
trans-unit.target: System.Configuration.ConfigurationErrorsException: Configuration binding extension 'system.serviceModel/bindings/netTcpRelayBinding' could not be found.

trans-unit.source: Verify that this binding extension is correctly registered in system.serviceModel/extensions/bindingExtensions and that it is spelled correctly.
trans-unit.target: Verify that this binding extension is correctly registered in system.serviceModel/extensions/bindingExtensions and that it is spelled correctly.

trans-unit.source: Cause
trans-unit.target: Cause

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> assemblies are currently not integrated into the <token>azure_1</token> platform.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> assemblies are currently not integrated into the <token>azure_1</token> platform.

trans-unit.source: On the local computer, if you have the <token>azure_1</token> SDK installed, your Machine.config file will be modified to add several <token>indigo1</token> extensions, such as <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: On the local computer, if you have the <token>azure_1</token> SDK installed, your Machine.config file will be modified to add several <token>indigo1</token> extensions, such as <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: The application can then find the relevant information in the Machine.config file, such as in the <codeInline>netTcpRelayBinding</codeInline> section.
trans-unit.target: The application can then find the relevant information in the Machine.config file, such as in the <codeInline>netTcpRelayBinding</codeInline> section.

trans-unit.source: This does not occur on the <token>azure_1</token> platform, therefore the application cannot find the relevant information.
trans-unit.target: This does not occur on the <token>azure_1</token> platform, therefore the application cannot find the relevant information.

trans-unit.source: Resolution
trans-unit.target: Resolution

trans-unit.source: For your configuration to work with <token>azure_1</token>, copy the extensions from the local Machine.config file to your App.config file.
trans-unit.target: For your configuration to work with <token>azure_1</token>, copy the extensions from the local Machine.config file to your App.config file.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, tags such as <codeInline>netTcpRelayBinding</codeInline> will not be recognized.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, tags such as <codeInline>netTcpRelayBinding</codeInline> will not be recognized.

trans-unit.source: However, if you do this, your application will not run locally because of duplicate extensions.
trans-unit.target: However, if you do this, your application will not run locally because of duplicate extensions.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you will have to keep two versions of the App.config file; one locally, and one for <token>azure_1</token>.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, you will have to keep two versions of the App.config file; one locally, and one for <token>azure_1</token>.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you to perform this particular task programmatically.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you to perform this particular task programmatically.

trans-unit.source: Connectivity issues
trans-unit.target: Connectivity issues

trans-unit.source: The following troubleshooting topics contain information about how to connect to <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following troubleshooting topics contain information about how to connect to <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: If you cannot find your solution later in this section, you may want to consider one of the following possibilities:
trans-unit.target: If you cannot find your solution later in this section, you may want to consider one of the following possibilities:

trans-unit.source: Run a network trace – the network may be down.
trans-unit.target: Run a network trace – the network may be down.

trans-unit.source: Using Network Monitor to determine the status of the network may assist you in debugging your problem.
trans-unit.target: Using Network Monitor to determine the status of the network may assist you in debugging your problem.

trans-unit.source: Client application cannot find the targeted endpoint
trans-unit.target: Client application cannot find the targeted endpoint

trans-unit.source: Symptom
trans-unit.target: Symptom

trans-unit.source: When you attempt to connect to <token>sb2</token> with a client application, you receive the following error:
trans-unit.target: When you attempt to connect to <token>sb2</token> with a client application, you receive the following error:

trans-unit.source: Unhandled Exception: System.ServiceModel.EndpointNotFoundException: The endpoint was not found.
trans-unit.target: Unhandled Exception: System.ServiceModel.EndpointNotFoundException: The endpoint was not found.

trans-unit.source: Please make sure that you can connect to the Internet using HTTP port 80 and TCP port 808.
trans-unit.target: Please make sure that you can connect to the Internet using HTTP port 80 and TCP port 808.

trans-unit.source: Cause
trans-unit.target: Cause

trans-unit.source: There are a variety of possible causes for this error.
trans-unit.target: There are a variety of possible causes for this error.

trans-unit.source: Resolution
trans-unit.target: Resolution

trans-unit.source: Check to see whether the host is running.
trans-unit.target: Check to see whether the host is running.

trans-unit.source: If not, there is no endpoint to which to connect.
trans-unit.target: If not, there is no endpoint to which to connect.

trans-unit.source: You can run the service by using one of the two procedures that are shown here:
trans-unit.target: You can run the service by using one of the two procedures that are shown here:

trans-unit.source: Debug Mode - Right click your service project in the <token>vs_current_short</token> <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, click <ui>Debug</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Debug Mode - Right click your service project in the <token>vs_current_short</token> <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, click <ui>Debug</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Then click <ui>Start new instance</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Then click <ui>Start new instance</ui>.

trans-unit.source: After the service starts, repeat this procedure for the client.
trans-unit.target: After the service starts, repeat this procedure for the client.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can debug the client even though the service is already running.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can debug the client even though the service is already running.

trans-unit.source: Outside Debug Mode - Set your service project as the start-up project.
trans-unit.target: Outside Debug Mode - Set your service project as the start-up project.

trans-unit.source: From the <ui>Debug</ui> menu, click <ui>Start Without Debugging</ui>.
trans-unit.target: From the <ui>Debug</ui> menu, click <ui>Start Without Debugging</ui>.

trans-unit.source: By doing this, although the service application will run, <token>vs_current_short</token> is not affected.
trans-unit.target: By doing this, although the service application will run, <token>vs_current_short</token> is not affected.

trans-unit.source: After the service starts, set the client project as the startup project, then run it.
trans-unit.target: After the service starts, set the client project as the startup project, then run it.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you have set the <ui>Copy Local</ui> property for the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll assembly (in <token>vs_current_short</token>) to <ui>true</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you have set the <ui>Copy Local</ui> property for the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll assembly (in <token>vs_current_short</token>) to <ui>true</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The cloud servers do not have the <token>azure_2</token> SDK installed.
trans-unit.target: The cloud servers do not have the <token>azure_2</token> SDK installed.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you must include the assembly with your package.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, you must include the assembly with your package.

trans-unit.source: Without it, your worker role will not run correctly.
trans-unit.target: Without it, your worker role will not run correctly.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that you can, in fact, connect to the Internet using HTTP port 80 and TCP port 808.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that you can, in fact, connect to the Internet using HTTP port 80 and TCP port 808.

trans-unit.source: Client is unable to finish the security negotiation in the configured time-out
trans-unit.target: Client is unable to finish the security negotiation in the configured time-out

trans-unit.source: Symptom
trans-unit.target: Symptom

trans-unit.source: The application is not able to connect to <token>sb2</token>, and instead returns the following error message:
trans-unit.target: The application is not able to connect to <token>sb2</token>, and instead returns the following error message:

trans-unit.source: "Client is unable to finish the security negotiation in the configured time-out (00:01:00).
trans-unit.target: "Client is unable to finish the security negotiation in the configured time-out (00:01:00).

trans-unit.source: The current negotiation leg is 1 (00:00:59.9429968)."
trans-unit.target: The current negotiation leg is 1 (00:00:59.9429968)."

trans-unit.source: Cause
trans-unit.target: Cause

trans-unit.source: The authentication credentials may be set incorrectly.
trans-unit.target: The authentication credentials may be set incorrectly.

trans-unit.source: Resolution
trans-unit.target: Resolution

trans-unit.source: Check to see whether you are authenticating the client.
trans-unit.target: Check to see whether you are authenticating the client.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, check to see whether you have you set <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType</codeEntityReference> to <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.None</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, check to see whether you have you set <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType</codeEntityReference> to <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.None</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: By default, the value is <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference>, which requires that you provide an authentication claim, such as a shared secret.
trans-unit.target: By default, the value is <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference>, which requires that you provide an authentication claim, such as a shared secret.

trans-unit.source: However, if you manually set the value to <languageKeyword>None</languageKeyword>, the client should not provide any authentication.
trans-unit.target: However, if you manually set the value to <languageKeyword>None</languageKeyword>, the client should not provide any authentication.

trans-unit.source: If you have not set the authentication type, you likely have <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType</codeEntityReference> with the default <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference> value.
trans-unit.target: If you have not set the authentication type, you likely have <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType</codeEntityReference> with the default <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference> value.

trans-unit.source: If this is the case, check to see whether your authentication claim is specified correctly.
trans-unit.target: If this is the case, check to see whether your authentication claim is specified correctly.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating an AppFabric Service Bus Connection</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating an AppFabric Service Bus Connection</link>.

trans-unit.source: Application cannot verify security when it connects to Service Bus
trans-unit.target: Application cannot verify security when it connects to Service Bus

trans-unit.source: Symptom
trans-unit.target: Symptom

trans-unit.source: When trying to connect to <token>sb2</token>, you receive the following error:
trans-unit.target: When trying to connect to <token>sb2</token>, you receive the following error:

trans-unit.source: "An error occurred when verifying security for the message"
trans-unit.target: "An error occurred when verifying security for the message"

trans-unit.source: Cause
trans-unit.target: Cause

trans-unit.source: One possible cause of this error is that the UTC time for the local computer is ahead of the UTC time on the server.
trans-unit.target: One possible cause of this error is that the UTC time for the local computer is ahead of the UTC time on the server.

trans-unit.source: For example, the local UTC time stamp may be 8:06, whereas on the server the time stamp is 8:05.
trans-unit.target: For example, the local UTC time stamp may be 8:06, whereas on the server the time stamp is 8:05.

trans-unit.source: The server considers this to be an invalid time stamp, and generates the error message that is mentioned in the "Symptoms" section.
trans-unit.target: The server considers this to be an invalid time stamp, and generates the error message that is mentioned in the "Symptoms" section.

trans-unit.source: Resolution
trans-unit.target: Resolution

trans-unit.source: Confirm that the UTC time for the local computer is correct.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that the UTC time for the local computer is correct.

trans-unit.source: If necessary, manually set the clock back several minutes.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, manually set the clock back several minutes.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> does not consider slightly older messages to be a security violation; only ones that appear to come from further in the future.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> does not consider slightly older messages to be a security violation; only ones that appear to come from further in the future.

trans-unit.source: The ATOM feed does not display your service
trans-unit.target: The ATOM feed does not display your service

trans-unit.source: Symptom
trans-unit.target: Symptom

trans-unit.source: You cannot locate a service on the ATOM feed, even though you know the service is successfully running.
trans-unit.target: You cannot locate a service on the ATOM feed, even though you know the service is successfully running.

trans-unit.source: Cause
trans-unit.target: Cause

trans-unit.source: The default behavior for the service registry is not to expose a service through the ATOM feed.
trans-unit.target: The default behavior for the service registry is not to expose a service through the ATOM feed.

trans-unit.source: Resolution
trans-unit.target: Resolution

trans-unit.source: Set the endpoint to be discoverable, as described in <link xlink:href="69553490-bb60-46e7-aca2-b8aac8952d2b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Publish a Service to the AppFabric Service Bus Registry</link>.
trans-unit.target: Set the endpoint to be discoverable, as described in <link xlink:href="69553490-bb60-46e7-aca2-b8aac8952d2b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Publish a Service to the AppFabric Service Bus Registry</link>.
